issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: When using SDK 8 and Swift modules, the framework search paths should be injected by the template instead of handling them manually. This used to be done for header search paths and ObjC modules, so you should clean up the template and should be fine,.
fields.summary: iOS: Default framework header search paths should be injected by template

comments.body:
PR: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/10372

To test:
1. Create a new Swift module with {{ti create -t module}}
2. Open the module in Xcode
3. Try to build it in Xcode (CMD+B)

Expected behavior: A "Build succeeded" notification.

*Closing ticket* verified fix in SDK version {{8.0.0.v20181127032313}} with the test case mentioned above in the description. 

*Test Environment*
{code:java}
APPC Studio: 5.1.0.201808080937
APPC CLI: 7.0.7
Operating System Name: Mac OS Mojave
Operating System Version: 10.14.1
Node.js Version: 8.9.1
Xcode 10.1
{code}
